column4: hello, i have a question: when i did apt-get install logwatch, i got this message:
Suggested packages:
fortune-mod
this isnt the first time i saw that 'suggested' thing too
but how do i find out more ?
trying to put the name on google just gives things like file lists or package size
but how do i learn what that ACTUALLY IS and why it was suggested ?
why not browse the source code of the application you're installing?
is that a joke ?
you think im going to learn a new programming language and randomly read through source to find out what a piece of software does ?
no, sorry. it sounds like you want to learn & you're not quite sure /what/ you want to learn, right?
no, im very sure: i want to learn what that package is
oh i'm sorry i thought you were asking about how to just keep learning
theres no way there arent descriptions somewhere
usually the search string "ubuntu package "name"" will bring you a page with descriptions
let me see about that particular package
yeah, i got this
http://packages.ubuntu.com/precise/fortune-mod
but thats not really helpful to people who dont know what it is
thanks
yes [twisti] see here: https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/fortune-mod
and thank llutz too
most of the ubuntu packages that will be suggested will have a page on launchpad. from there you can view the readme or source etc & find what a package does / is for etc.
